result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CODY JONATHAN BARTELS

records.addlTxt:
11:25 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CODY JONATHAN BARTELS in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for CODY JONATHAN BARTELS. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Ct 1: Defendant enters no contest plea.
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

21CF269 Cts 2, 3,4, and 21CF453 & 22CF374 entirely DRI

Court orders:
S/w - 3 years probation
drugs/para/norx/shot/noact/
any counseling
$518
DNA
19 days credit if revoked
Bond posted in 21CF453 to be applied to costs
(Jail w/ voter inelig, probation letter, pmt slip/2406)
(Probation/2411)

Defendant ask for bond modification. 
ADA Zehr objects to bond modification. 
Attorney Harless requests bond to be modified to a signature bond. 
Court denies bond modification.
